page.title: 02Clubs in South Kyme
page.content: The Women's Institute meets monthly, throughout the year, to hear a variety of speakers and demonstrators. The W.I. was formed in 1921 & is a very active group in the community. The South Kyme United Football Club, formed in 1947, now plays regularly on a Sunday morning, during the football season. The team plays in the Boston Sunday League. The club provides interest for many people, besides players, in its' running. The Youth Club was formed in 1977, & meets weekly, during the winter months. Members play snooker, table tennis, darts etc. & dance to records. It was formed from money raised in the village during Jubilee Year (1977). Children in the village belong to Cubs, Boy Scouts and Brownies, but have to go out of the village to pursue these activities.
